channel.title: Statistics on Data Science Garage
channel.description: Recent content in Statistics on Data Science Garage

item.title: 2.1 Question, explore, analyze
item.description: Question, explore, analyze (a workflow for data science) VIDEO 2.1 SCRIPT 2.1 Use this to follow along on this page and for the Practice exercises below. Optional reference to review key concepts: Danielle Navarro. 2019. Learning Statistics with R Overview A dataset often comes to the Data Scientist in an imperfect state, possibly incomplete, containing errors, and with minimal description. Likewise, it may contain wonderful knowledge, there to discover.

item.title: 2.3 Correlation
item.description: Question, explore, analyze (a workflow for data science) VIDEO 2.3 SCRIPT 2.3 Use this to follow along on this page and for the Practice exercises below. Overview A dataset often comes to the Data Scientist in an imperfect state, possibly incomplete, containing errors, and with minimal description. Likewise, it may contain wonderful knowledge, there to discover. Either way, your first task is to weigh the pig.

item.title: 2.5 T-test
item.description: T-test (and related questions and tools) VIDEO 2.5 SCRIPT 2.5 Use this to follow along on this page and for the Practice exercises below. Overview A dataset often comes to the Data Scientist in an imperfect state, possibly incomplete, containing errors, and with minimal description. Likewise, it may contain wonderful knowledge, there to discover. Either way, your first task is to weigh the pig. The very first task for any data analysis is to gain an understanding of the data itself.
